data.description: If I see something, I’ll say something. And you can too. Support keeping NY safe by changing your profile picture now!

data.message: Here's what I see. I see a system not giving a damn about its customers, the riders. Everytime you hear a mumbled announcement [diction anybody?] you know it's bad news. It's never a positive announcement, always, 'due to and earlier incident' we don't give a damn. How long does it take them to resume normal service [which is not that great anyway]. Don't they have work-around plans for situations that might crop up? I see a non-service that has decided that the people who keep the city going 24/7 are not worth the effort of giving them the value of the fare. Does the MTA think that nobody needs to get to and from work even after midnight and during the weekend. Isn't that also the time tourists are checking out the night life? So here's something I'll say; shame on you for failing to give the service our fare money should rightly be buying. We don't need a bunch of overpaid bigwigs, we need a lean efficient management doing their job.

MTA eTix™ App Comes to the Harlem Line on Monday!

MTA eTix™, the ticketing app that allows Metro-North customers to buy train tickets anytime, anywhere on their smartphone, will be available on our Harlem Line starting at 4:26 a.m. on Monday, July 25, when the Line’s first train of the week departs from its first station.

Get more info on MTA eTix™ at http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo

data.message: Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA), service has been awful recently with constant delays due to signal problems at stations in every borough. It is unacceptable. I am tired of hearing about wifi and portable charging ports on subways and buses. The SERVICE and infrastructure needs to improve. What are you doing to work on the basic movement of trains to ensure they can operate on time and reliably? Because that is not happening now.
USB ports in the trains? Great idea.. except we cannot handle nice things. They will be either pissed on or some dick head is going to put his gum in it.

Wow this is great! Really great....until a homeless person decides to sleep there for the night & stink up the entire train. Or decides to use it as a bathroom. Or decides to make it a smokers train. Or crazy people decide to roam the entire train freaking people out. Violence instead of being confined to 1 car can now spread throughout the train. But hey why should that stop you from spending our money by raising the fare until it's cheaper to have a car or motorcycle. Just BRILLIANT!

You people will do ANYTHING do complain. Like DAAAAMN, can you guys be happy for once? AT LEAST YOU HAVE 24/7 TRAIN SERVICE!!!! Look at other cities, some of them have no type of transit system at all. Plus, almost every city in America does not run their trains overnight, but we do. Now stop being ungrateful and appreciate what you have!
Thank GOD that subways cars are getting a new exterior and LED headlights!  That will solve all the problems with an overtaxed outdated system!

How about correcting signals so we aren't taking 4 hours to get to and from work, or cleaning the old stations up not just tourist stops like times sq, and how about improving security and safety and removing people who disrupt, take up a whole seating arrangement for their shopping carts and filth, and we clean up every station to improve services and customer satisfaction. You give us wifi and call it a damn day when Thats not what improves the ridiculousness and he hassle of every day commute
While this is nice, I'd much appreciate giving the subway infrastructure a good modernizing. With all the signal / track problems, I wouldn't be surprised if we're due for an update in that area!

How about you put money towards fixing the bus and train services? Maybe then more people will take public transportation and traffic will ease up in and around the city.... Look at that I just did someone's job

It's really nice to see that I'm not the only one thinking when are we getting to 21st century subway system I mean I love the subway but let's be real New York City is like "the City" and other cities around the world there Subways are looking way better so it's really nice to see that what they're doing one small comment I did notice that the pictures only seem to be modernizing but they should have liked more staircases and entrances to the Subway
I'd be more happy with the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) working properly than looking nicer. Almost everyday there is a delay. Yet they always want to hike up the rates?

Instead of working on a design why not work on better service, conductors who actually inform people of delays instead of just waiting in limbo, and perhaps more subways on the lines with heavier traffic. For example L train ever 7 mins is ridiculous for the amount of people who take this subway why not ever 5 mins during peak periods. Why not working on coming up with a plan to assist homeless people that sleep on the trains. This list is endless the design should not be the concern right now. God even Chambers Street.  That station as the same peeling paint, Pigeon poop since I wascin High School.  Seriously. I get it. My money and that of my entire family pays enough.  Over 50 years of station riding.  Now with the boom of gentrification and L.E.S. tourism.  Plans so many plans yet the station is Hot as hell.  Escalators dirty. Walls filthy. So much money spent on Fulton Street hub or The L 34th. St. Hudson Yard Station.   All the cars need is a man at every now and then to wipe spillage on seats.

There a difference between "needs" and 'wants" ... We need better subway cars, cleaner and safer stations, etc. Seriously, do we really have to spend $$$ so people can use their I-Phones and charge their cellphones?

Let us get COPPER hand holds.  Recent studies have shown that copper alloy surfaces kill E. coli O157:H7. Over 99.9% of E. coli microbes are killed after just 1–2 hours on copper. On stainless steel surfaces, the microbes can survive for weeks.

I see comments all over saying we should be appreciative of the fact we have 24 hour service that not many cities have and yada yada. Here's what you don't understand, when your train line is terrible like the 6, G, and R, you can't appreciate that. No one wants to appreciate being under served at all. Just like that damn wifi bus, but yet there are other lines that still suck. Some of these changes I wouldn't mind seeing, but to "modernise the MTA" and you want to put wifi and USB ports on board open gangway trains...I'll let you think of the outcome of that situation. Yet the MTA says, "don't display cellphones and other electronic devices"... hypocritical much? What SHOULD be wifi and USB prioritised are the express buses and railroad trains (LIRR and Metro-North), we don't really need it on the subway or local bus. Just focus on bettering the physical operation of the system foremost then go on to the pleasurable amenities.

All of this looks great, I just wonder why some of the subway stations cannot be cleaner....not suggesting eat off the floor clean but some really nice tile is streaked with decades worth of crud.  Oh and the essence of urine in the E Train World Trade station never seems to go away....will be interesting when this station gets connected with the white stone Downtown Transportation hub and the PATH.....what a contrast that will be.  A bit of cleaning would really be nice.

Maybe what mta should do is put a sign on the busses and trains that CLEARLY state that if there is a passenger standing and an mta worker sitting down they should get up and offer their seat to them. Their passes allow them on the train and bus for free while we have to pay. My fiancé is an mta worker himself and he ALWAYS gets up. I was on the B15 bus on Friday afternoon around 5 and an off duty lady was sitting in the bus in the front with her bag next to her and she clearly saw me struggling with my baby in a car seat and didn't bother to move her bag off the seat OR get up herself. When I told her that mta workers are supposed to get up for curtesy she said I just got off a shift since 4 in the morning and I'm off duty. I don't have to get up for you. She also stated that other PAYING customers are the ones who have to get up. Customers only have to get up if they feel like it but it was her duty as a worker to get up. She just made mta officials look bad because she was rude and had no sense of compassion to even bother to get up. 
Next time I will definitely get her name off her pass and report her to her bosses. I didn't do it this time because I had my baby and I didn't want to put her in any unnecessary situation. 

Mta should clearly tell their workers to get up for civilians if they are standing. ESPECIALLY the elderly, disabled, AND people with babies / small children. 
This lady obviously has no heart. 
Worse bus experience ever. Do something mta!

Cars look longer, wider doors are better. Exterior, who cares. The city is entropy realized. Everything that is not actively maintained will crumble and turn to disorder. Do not Cut the F train Local Service --------- Dear MTA:

As a resident of Carroll Gardens, my family depends on the F train to commute to work. The proposed plan to make the subway express will affect us and already add about 10 minutes to our work days as we need to meet hard deadlines picking our kids from daycare/school so need to take into account the extra uncertainty.

The plan seem fine as long as more trains are added to the mix. Also PLEASE fix your communication. We often only get last minute notice at Jay street that the train is running express. The acoustic is poor and we are often left guessing between commuters what the next stop will be.

We'll make sure to schedule arriving and departing trains all at the same time. We'll leave you stranded because we have poor communications between departments and haven't figured out how train systems operate in other countries so efficiently.
